poem:
Title: The Experiment of Empathy

Down fell the ladder of British Columbia's strive,
An experiment of empathy, no longer alive.
Urban disorder and public angst unfurl,
In the heartland of the Canadian pearl.
Decriminalization, unexpectedly unstitched,
By the Premier's hand, once bewitched.
Inverse Eden, shadowed under the law,
In the quest of humanity, a fault raw.
